title: Make and Use a Rabbit Stick
brief: Create and use a curved throwing stick effective against small game like rabbits and squirrels.
steps: Step 1: Select a stick naturally curved at about 45 degrees from heavy hardwood like oak.
Step 2: Shave off two opposite sides so the stick is flat like a boomerang.
Step 3: To throw: align target by extending non-throwing arm toward mid-to-lower section of target.
Step 4: Raise throwing arm up and back until stick crosses your back at 45 degrees or aligns with non-throwing hip.
Step 5: Bring throwing arm forward until slightly above and parallel to non-throwing arm - this is the release point.
Step 6: Practice the motion slowly and repeatedly to develop accuracy.
warnings: Requires extensive practice to achieve accuracy and speed.
Only effective against small game - not suitable for larger animals.
Practice in a safe area away from people and property.
